Kako so pametni telefoni spremenili svet
Pametni telefon je nadomestil fotoaparat, videokamero, osebni računalnik, navigacijo, videokonzolo, osebnega trenerja in še kaj.
03 Nov 2019, 08:13 by Staš Ivanc



Ko je Steve Jobs leta 2007 predstavil prvi iphone, si nihče ni predstavljal, kaj bo čez dobrih deset let. FOTO: Reuters



Prvi androidni telefon je bil HTC dream. FOTO: Reuters



Pametni telefon v enem združuje vrsto naprav in pripomočkov. FOTO: Guliver/Getty Images



Pametni telefoni so postali nekaj nepogrešljivega. FOTO: Guliver/Getty Images



Videovsebine na dotik FOTO: Guliver/Getty Images



Hrana je ena najbolj priljubljenih motivov telefonske fotografije. FOTO: Guliver/Getty Images



V določenih družbah je tako rekoč nemogoče odložiti telefon, hrana pa je ena najbolj priljubljenih motivov telefonske fotografije. FOTO: Guliver/Getty Images


Ko je zdaj že pokojni soustanovitelj in šef Appla Steve Jobs leta 2007 ponosno predstavil prvi iphone kot telefon, predvajalnik glasbe in spletni komunikator v enem, je bila to brez dvoma ena od glavnih tehnoloških prelomnic novega tisočletja. Saj so pametni telefoni obstajali že prej, a dotlej še noben ni ponujal takšne uporabniške izkušnje. Imel je zanesljiv zaslon, občutljiv za dotik, predvajal je multimedijske vsebine, končno je bilo mogoče normalno brskati po internetu in pregledovati elektronsko pošto – in še videti je bil kul. A če zdaj pogledamo nazaj, so tri stvari, o katerih je govoril Jobs, le vrh ledene gore zmogljivosti in uporabnosti sodobnih pametnih telefonov.
Vseprisotni telefoni
Dandanes lahko tako rekoč vse počnemo s telefonom. »Nismo si mogli niti predstavljati, da bo iphone deset let pozneje postal tako ključni del našega življenja: od pretakanja televizijskih oddaj in igranja mobilnih iger prek navigacije, rezervacij letalskih poletov in hotelov ter spremljanja telesnih aktivnosti in zdravja do upravljanja varnostnih kamer in centralne kurjave ter deljenja spominov z odličnimi fotografijami in videi,« je spletnemu portalu Cnet zaupal Phil Schiller, vodja marketinga pri Applu.
Tudi pri Applu si niso niti predstavljali, da bodo pametni telefoni postali tako pomembni del našega življenja.
Dejstvo je, da nobena tehnologija zadnjega desetletja ni tako dramatično spremenila našega življenja kakor prav pametni telefon. Ko je luč sveta ugledal prvi iphone, leto pozneje pa še prvi androidni telefon HTC dream, sta bili to še napravi za tehnološke navdušence s polnimi denarnicami. Še pred desetimi leti smo šele začeli odkrivati potencial pametnih telefonov in mobilnih aplikacij.Kaj je edina stvar, brez katere res ne gremo od doma? Zelo verjetno je to pametni telefon. Še denarnico večkrat pozabimo doma ... Zdaj je za nas samoumevno, da imamo v žepu pravi mali multimedijski računalnik. S telefonom si naročimo taksi, gledamo filme in serije iz bogatih zbirk ponudnikov ali pa v živo pretakamo trapaste videe. S prijatelji se spopadamo v fortnitu in iščemo pokemončke po mestih, lahko pa tudi popolnoma zaupno komuniciramo s pomočjo aplikacij, ki zakodirajo naše klepete.
Moč aplikacij


Prvi androidni telefon je bil HTC dream. FOTO: Reuters

Pametni telefoni so obstajali že prej, toda iphone je spremenil njihov pomen in uporabnost. V letu po izidu je Apple splovil še trgovino z aplikacijami za mobilni operacijski sistem ios App Store, ki je iphonu dala popolnoma nove razsežnosti, le malo za njim pa je isto s trgovino Android Market storil še Google, katerega operacijski sistem android, ki ga je ponujal tudi drugim proizvajalcem, je v naslednjih letih postal najbolj razširjen po vsem svetu; trenutno obstaja več kot poltretja milijarda androidnih naprav.»Zdaj ima tako rekoč že vsakdo pametni telefon,« pravi Peter Chou, soustanovitelj in nekdanji šef HTC, ki je v sodelovanju z Googlom izdelal prvi androidni telefon. A android je leta 2009 populariziral šele Motorolin droid, ki je kot prvi imel naložene tudi brezplačne Googlove zemljevide. Nato pa je leta 2010 v androidno igro vstopil Samsung, ki je z njim opremil svojo novo premijsko serijo S.In aplikacije so tisto, kar je pametne telefone naredilo privlačne. V App Storu in Googlovi trgovini play se je v osmih letih nabralo več kot dva milijona aplikacij: od instagrama in jeznih ptičev z večstomilijonskimi prenosi do skoraj popolnoma neznanih aplikacij za opazovanje ptic. In v zgodnji dobi aplikacij se je v trgovinah znašlo marsikaj popolnoma debilnega, še posebno v Googlovi trgovini, ki je veljala za pravi Divji zahod, saj sprva ni imela tako ostrega nadzora nad aplikacijami kot App Store. No, tudi zdaj se v njej znajdejo sumljive aplikacije ... Rasla je tudi uporabnost samih aplikacij. Dandanes se človek tako rekoč ne more več izgubiti zaradi Googlovih (in Applovih) zemljevidov. Protestniki (denimo v Barceloni in Hongkongu) med seboj komunicirajo prek varnih aplikacij za takojšnje sporočanje, kjer je vsa komunikacija zakodirana, ljubitelji gibljivih slik imajo prek aplikacij pretočnih servisov, kot so Netflix, Hulu, Amazon prime video in HBO go, na razpolago neprimerno več filmov in serij, kolikor bi jih lahko pogledali v celem življenju oziroma več življenjih.Velike spremembe


Pametni telefoni so postali nekaj nepogrešljivega. FOTO: Guliver/Getty Images

Ko je Samsung leta 2011 predstavil prvi galaxy note, so se vsi norčevali iz njegovega velikanskega zaslona, ki je po diagonali meril glomaznih 13,5 centimetra oziroma 5,3 palca. Prvi iphone je imel le devetmilimetrski (3,5-palčni) zaslon. Zdaj se izvirni note zdi kompakten, saj ima aktualni note 10+ več kot 17-centimetrski (6,8-palčni) zaslon, iphone 11 pro max pa 16,5-centimetrskega.Ko se je tehnologija začela usmerjati k zaslonskim tipkovnicam, so se številni spraševali, ali je to sploh smiselno, ali se bomo lahko poslovili od »zanesljivejših« fizičnih tipk. Leta 2009 so proizvajalci na telefone še vedno poskušali stlačiti poln nabor tipk – HTC dream je, denimo, še imel izvlečno tipkovnico.Pametni telefoni pa so revolucionalizirali tudi fotografijo: kdo sploh še slika s »trotlziher« fotoaparatom oziroma snema video s kompaktno kamero? Le malokdo še uporablja namenske navigacijske naprave, da o tiskanih zemljevidih niti ne govorimo. Ali pa prenosni glasbeni predvajalniki ali po domače empetriji? Diktafone pa uporablja le še redkokdo.Padla je tudi prodaja zapestnih ur, saj smo se vsi navadili gledati na telefone – niso postale priljubljene pametne ure in zapestnice, ki pa se seveda povežejo s kom drugim kot s pametnim telefonom.
Vzpon Kitajske


Videovsebine na dotik FOTO: Guliver/Getty Images

Mobilniška revolucija je bila dovolj radikalna, da je pokopala kar več velikih imen, ki niso šla v korak s časom. Nokia in BlackBerry sta bila nekoč absolutna vladarja vsak na svojem področju, zdaj pa ne delata več svojih telefonov, ampak sta preprosto prodala blagovno znamko. Tudi nekdaj močna Motorola je v lasti kitajskega giganta Lenovo. Microsoft kljub prevzemu Nokijinih telefonov ni mogel zagotoviti preživetja lastnemu mobilnemu operacijskemu sistemu windows phone, HTC, ki je izdelal prvi androidni telefon, pa je skoraj izginil s trga.Medtem ko Samsung ostaja nesporni kralj trga pametnih telefonov, Apple pa ustvarja največje dobičke, so se pojavili novi igralci iz Kitajske. Huawei, ki je še naprej v sporu z ameriško administracijo, je v zadnjih letih postal drugi največji proizvajalec pametnih telefonov na svetu, pa čeprav jih v ZDA sploh ne prodaja. TCL, ki ga še najbolje poznamo po cenovno ugodnih televizorjih, je prevzel blagovno znamko BlackBerry, na zahod pa se počasi prebijajo tudi druge telefonske blagovne znamke, kot so Xiaomi, Oppo, Vivo in OnePlus (zadnje tri so v lasti korporacije BBK Electronics).
Nadzor nad uporabo


Hrana je ena najbolj priljubljenih motivov telefonske fotografije. FOTO: Guliver/Getty Images

Minili so časi, ko smo se slinili nad novimi telefoni. Čeprav so inovacije še vedno na vidiku, pa smo postali bolj kritični do tega, kako pametni telefoni v resnici vplivajo na naše vsakdanje življenje. Ko zaslišimo zvok za obvestilo ali začutimo brnenje, refleksno sežemo po telefonu, da ja ne bi česa zamudili. Odvisnost od telefončka ni zanemarljiva malenkost. Tako da zdaj iste korporacije, ki nam prodajajo vse te naprave, ki so zasedle pomembno vlogo v našem življenju, razvijajo tudi aplikacije in funkcije samega operacijskega sistema, s pomočjo katerih naj bi zmanjšali čas, ki ga preživimo med buljenjem v zaslončke.Funkciji screen time v Applovem iosu in digitalno ravnovesje na Googlovem androidu nam tako dajeta vpogled v to, koliko časa namenimo posamezni aplikaciji na telefonu. Starši lahko prek screen tima na iphonu spremljamo tudi, kaj počno naši potomci na telefonu; na androidnih telefonih lahko to počnemo z Googlovo aplikacijo family link.Časi so se od tedaj, ko smo s pametnimi telefoni le telefonirali, poslušali glasbo in brskali po internetu, konkretno spremenili.
2,5 milijarde androidnih naprav je trenutno na svetu.
text:
How smartphones have changed the world
The smartphone has replaced the camera, camcorder, PC, navigation, video console, personal trainer and more.
03 Nov 2019, 08:13 by Stas Ivanc



When Steve Jobs introduced the first iphone in 2007, no one imagined what it would be like in a good ten years. PHOTO: Reuters



The first android phone was the HTC dream. PHOTO: Reuters



A smartphone combines a range of devices and gadgets into one. PHOTO: Gulliver / Getty Images



Smartphones have become something indispensable. PHOTO: Gulliver / Getty Images



Touch Screen Videos PHOTO: Gulliver / Getty Images



Food is one of the most popular phone photography motifs. PHOTO: Gulliver / Getty Images



In some companies, it is virtually impossible to put away the phone, and food is one of the most popular motifs of phone photography. PHOTO: Gulliver / Getty Images


When now-deceased Appla co-founder and boss Steve Jobs proudly introduced the first iphone in 2007 as a phone, music player and web communicator in one, this was without a doubt one of the major technological milestones of the new millennium. Smartphones existed before, but so far none have offered such a user experience. It had a reliable touch screen, played multimedia content, and finally it was possible to browse the Internet normally and browse email - and it still looked cool. But looking back now, the three things Jobs talked about are just the tip of the iceberg of the capabilities and usability of modern smartphones.
Ubiquitous phones
Today, we can almost do everything with the phone. "We couldn't even imagine that the iPhone would become such a crucial part of our lives ten years later: from streaming TV shows and playing mobile games through navigation, booking flights and hotels and monitoring physical activity and health to managing security cameras and central fire, and sharing memories with great photos and videos, "said Phil Schiller, Apple's chief marketing officer, at Cnet.
Even at Apple, they never imagined that smartphones would become such an important part of our lives.
The fact is that no technology in the last decade has changed our lives as dramatically as a smartphone. When the light of the world saw the first iphone and a year later the first android HTC dream phone, these were also devices for tech enthusiasts with full wallets. Ten years ago, we were just starting to discover the potential of smartphones and mobile apps. What is the one thing we really don't do without home? Very likely this is a smartphone. We forget the wallet more than once at home ... Now it goes without saying that we have a small multimedia computer in our pocket. We order a taxi by phone, watch movies and series from a rich collection of providers, or stream lively videos. We meet with friends at fortnit and search for pokemon in the cities, and we can also communicate with confidence through the applications that encode our chats.
The power of applications


The first android phone was the HTC dream. PHOTO: Reuters

Smartphones have existed before, but the iphone has changed their meaning and usability. In the year after its release, Apple launched the ios App Store mobile app store, which gave the iphone a whole new dimension, with Google doing just the same with the Android Market, its Android android operating system. also offered to other manufacturers, became the most widespread worldwide in the following years; There are currently more than half a billion billion android devices. "Now, so to speak, everyone has a smartphone," says Peter Chou, co-founder and former head of HTC, which, in collaboration with Google, created the first android phone. And in 2009, the Android only popularized the Motorola Droid, which also had free Google maps downloaded as the first. Then in 2010, an android game was introduced by Samsung, which equipped it with its new premium series S. And the apps are what made smartphones attractive. App Store and the Google Play Store have accumulated more than two million apps in eight years: from Instagram and angry birds with millions of downloads to almost completely unknown birdwatching apps. And in the early years of apps, many things were completely debatable in stores, especially in the Google Store, which was considered the true Wild West, because at first it did not have as much control over the apps as the App Store. Well, even now, it is running suspicious applications ... The usefulness of the applications themselves has grown. Nowadays, one can almost no longer get lost because of Google's (and Apple's) maps. Protesters (such as Barcelona and Hong Kong) communicate with each other via secure instant messaging applications, where all communication is encrypted, and moving image lovers have inappropriate more through streaming service applications such as Netflix, Hulu, Amazon prime video and HBO go movies and series as much as they could be viewed in a lifetime or multiple lives. Big changes


Smartphones have become something indispensable. PHOTO: Gulliver / Getty Images

When Samsung introduced the first galaxy note in 2011, everyone was making fun of its giant screen, measuring a whopping 13.5 centimeters or 5.3 inches diagonally. The first iphone had only a nine-millimeter (3.5-inch) screen. Now the original note seems compact, with the actual note 10+ having more than a 17-inch (6.8-inch) screen, and the iphone 11 pro max 16.5-centimeters. As technology began to move to on-screen keyboards, many wondered if it made any sense at all whether we could say goodbye to the "more reliable" physical keys. In 2009, manufacturers were still trying to squeeze a full set of phones onto their phones - HTC dream, for example, still had a pull-out keyboard. Few still use dedicated navigation devices, not to mention printed maps. Or portable music players or home empathy? However, the recorder uses only a few. The sale of wristwatches has also fallen, as we are all used to looking at phones - smartphones and bracelets have not become popular, but of course they connect to someone other than a smartphone.
The rise of China


Touch Screen Videos PHOTO: Gulliver / Getty Images

The mobile revolution was radical enough to bury as many big names as possible, who did not keep pace with the times. Nokia and BlackBerry were once absolute rulers in their respective fields, but now they no longer make their phones, but simply sell the brand. Even the once powerful Motorola is owned by Chinese giant Lenovo. Despite the takeover of Nokia's phones, Microsoft was unable to make a living on its own Windows Phone mobile phone, and HTC, which made the first Android phone, almost disappeared from the market. While Samsung remains the undisputed king of the smartphone market and Apple makes the biggest profits new players from China emerged. Huawei, which continues to be at odds with the US administration, has become the second largest smartphone maker in the world in recent years, even though it doesn't sell them in the US at all. TCL, best known for its affordable TVs, has taken over the BlackBerry brand, and other phone brands such as Xiaomi, Oppo, Vivo and OnePlus (the last three owned by BBK Electronics) are slowly moving west.
Use control


Food is one of the most popular phone photography motifs. PHOTO: Gulliver / Getty Images

There are times when we drool over new phones. Although innovation is still in sight, we have become more critical of how smartphones actually affect our daily lives. When we hear a notification sound or feel a buzz, we reflexively reach over the phone so that we do not miss anything. Phone addiction is not a small thing. So now the same corporations that sell us all these devices that have played an important role in our lives are also developing applications and features for the operating system itself, which are intended to reduce the time spent staring at apertures. Apple's iOS and digital balance on Google's Android give us an insight into how much time we spend on each app on our phone. Parents can also monitor, through the iphone screen team, what our offspring are doing on the phone; on android phones, we can do this with Google's family link app. Since then, when we only made smart phones, listened to music and surfed the internet, things have changed.
2.5 billion android devices are currently in the world.
